resources.string: The movie begins with a meticulously planned bank robbery orchestrated by the Joker. His henchmen eliminate each other until only the Joker remains, showcasing his ruthlessness and cunning. Gotham City is experiencing a reduction in crime due to Batmans efforts, District Attorney Harvey Dents (Aaron Eckhart) crackdown on organized crime, and the support of Lieutenant James Gordon (Gary Oldman). However, the Joker emerges as a new threat, intent on plunging the city into chaos. The Joker begins a reign of terror, targeting public officials and demanding Batman reveal his identity. His actions grow increasingly violent, leading to the death of many, including Commissioner Loeb and Judge Surillo. After being severely injured in a trap set by the Joker, Harvey Dent becomes Two-Face. His face is disfigured in an explosion that also kills Rachel Dawes (Maggie Gyllenhaal), Bruce Waynes love interest. The Joker continues to manipulate Gothams citizens and forces Batman to confront his own moral boundaries. Batman must decide whether to save Dent or Rachel, and he chooses Rachel, but the Jokers deceit leads to Dents rescue instead. The climax occurs in two locations: a building rigged with explosives and two ferries filled with passengers. The Jokers plan is to force the passengers to blow up the other ferry, but they refuse, proving Gothams citizens are not as corrupt as he believed. Batman captures the Joker but not before the Joker reveals that Dent has been corrupted. Two-Face kidnaps Gordons family, blaming Gordon for Rachels death. Batman intervenes, and in the ensuing struggle, Dent dies. To protect Dents reputation and maintain the hope he represents, Batman takes the blame for Dents crimes.

These four lonely walls have changed the way I feel The way I feel I am standing still And nothing else matters now you are not here So where are you? I have been calling you I am missing you Where else can I go? Where else can I go? Chasing you, chasing you Memories turn to dust
